[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Concurrency] [Payload modification] Can the on-chain stored payload be modified between transaction submission and execution, causing hash mismatch but still executing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Concurrency] [Clone race] If as_transaction_executable() clones EntryFunction while another thread reads it, can this cause data races or torn reads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Concurrency] [Reference invalidation] Can as_transaction_executable_ref() return a reference that gets invalidated if the Multisig is moved or dropped by another thread? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Economic] [Gas griefing] Can attacker submit Multisig transactions with None payload that consume minimal gas but cause expensive on-chain verification operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Economic] [Storage exhaustion] Can attacker create millions of tiny Multisig accounts with pending transactions to exhaust state storage and increase validator costs? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Economic] [Fee bypassing] Can None payload transactions execute without paying proper gas fees since they don't contain executable code? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [State] [Partial execution] If execution fails midway through as_transaction_executable(), can this leave the multisig account in an inconsistent state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [State] [Error state mismatch] Can ExecutionError conversion lose critical status information causing the blockchain state to record wrong execution results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [State] [Orphaned payloads] Can transaction_payload become orphaned (stored but never executed) if multisig_address is invalid, causing state bloat? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Crypto] [Signature verification bypass] Does the code assume signatures are already verified, or can an unsigned Multisig transaction reach as_transaction_executable()? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Crypto] [Hash algorithm] What hash algorithm is used for transaction_payload verification, and can attacker exploit hash weaknesses for collision attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Crypto] [Signature aggregation] If multisig uses BLS signature aggregation, can attacker forge aggregate signatures by exploiting math in the aggregation process? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Memory] [Buffer overflow] When deserializing large EntryFunction payloads, is there proper bounds checking to prevent buffer overflows? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Memory] [Use after free] Can as_transaction_executable() be called after Multisig is dropped, causing use-after-free if references are retained? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Memory] [Null pointer] Can transaction_payload being None cause null pointer dereferences in unsafe code blocks elsewhere in the codebase? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Type] [Enum exhaustion] If a future version adds new MultisigTransactionPayload variants, will old nodes reject them causing hard forks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Type] [Type confusion] Can EntryFunction be cast or transmuted to incompatible types causing memory corruption or arbitrary code execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [DoS] [Deserialization bomb] Can attacker craft deeply nested MultisigTransactionPayload structures that cause stack overflow during deserialization? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [DoS] [String allocation] Can extremely long abort_location or error_type strings in ExecutionError cause OOM during error handling? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [DoS] [Clone bomb] Can cloning a Multisig with specially crafted payload cause exponential memory growth or infinite loops? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Governance] [Owner bypass] Can non-owners of a multisig account submit Multisig transactions by exploiting missing authorization checks? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Governance] [Threshold manipulation] Can attacker modify the approval threshold after signatures are collected but before execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Governance] [Expiration bypass] If multisig transactions have expiration times, can attacker execute expired transactions by exploiting timestamp validation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Cross-contract] [Reentrancy] Can executing EntryFunction via multisig allow reentrancy attacks where the called contract recursively calls back into multisig? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/transaction/multisig.rs] [Cross-contract] [Callback manipulation] Can EntryFunction contain callbacks that execute with multisig privileges, bypassing approval requirements for sensitive operations? (Critical)
